intro: Dugandiodendron cubense, commonly known as the Cuban dugandi, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Cuba. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stem, palmate leaves, and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
